Instrument of Sasine proceeding on Resignation therein narrated, by Adam Wallace of Newtoun, alderman of Ayr, of his Walkmill, and pertinents, as to the see of it, situated within the territory of Ayr, in the Borowfeild thereof, King's Kyle, and shire of Ayr, between the lands of Holmeshill on the one side, and the water of Ayr on the other, together with a piece of land belonging to the said mill, and the salmon fishings of the “ croeS,'' in the milldam, in favour of the Friars Preachers of the church of St. Katherine of Ayr ε whereupon, Hugh Wallace, brother natural of the said Adam, also resigned his frank tenement of the said mill, land and fishingS, in favour of the said friars, in whose name Robert Prait, the prior, received sasine at the hands of Richard Reid, bailie of Ayr. Done in the public street of Ayr, near the church of the said friars, the resignations at ten and the sasine at eleven o'clock before noon, 29th February 1524.
